turns.content: A poor man and a rich man are accused of a crime. Who is guilty?

It is not fair to assume that one person is guilty simply based on their socioeconomic status. Both the poor man and the rich man should be considered innocent until proven guilty in a fair and impartial trial. The guilt or innocence of an individual should be determined based on the evidence presented in court and the legal process, not on their wealth or social status.
